pullRequest.title: Add error-prone check for system time zone usage
pullRequest.bodyText:
Error Prone has a built-in JavaTimeDefaultTimeZone check. However this check only matches implicit uses of the system default time zone.
There's no good reason to use the system default time zone so we should also prevent explicit uses. This PR add a JavaTimeSystemDefaultTimeZone error-prone check that matches these explicit uses and suggests a replacement.

commit.message: Add error-prone check for system time zone usage

nodes.bodyText: Should this be WARNING or ERROR?
